title: Meghalaya High Court seeks response on challenge to Khasi Lineage Act
content: Petition contests denial of Scheduled Tribe certificates to individuals using father’s or husband’s surname in matrilineal Khasi society

title: Plea in Supreme Court seeks political parties to comply with POSH law
content: The petitioner sent a representation to the Election Commission of India but has received no response till date, the plea added.

title: Collector expresses concern over growing number of school dropouts in Chittoor
content: Sumit Kumar highlights the imminent need to transform Chittoor into a district with zero dropouts and excellent academic standards

title: India-U.K. trade deal: Agri exports to grow 20% in 3 years, other key sectors to benefit
content: According to an official, the India-U.K. FTA deal “sharpens” India’s competitive edge on a number of agricultural and food-related items

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Take immediate steps to tackle floods, Raichur officers told
content: Rain-related incidents may possibly occur due to excess rain as per a forecast by Meteorological Department, says Deputy Commissioner

title: Seven Bills to be tabled to make Revenue Minister chairman of various authorities in Karnataka
content: Since the Chief Minister was burdened with the State administrative work, it was decided that amendments to make the Revenue Minister as the chairman would be brought in

title: DPR prepared for Central University’s Tiruchi campus
content: Five acres of land has been identified at Suriyur near Bharathidasan University and the State government has fixed the cost of land at ₹3 crore; total estimate of establishing the campus put at ₹23 crore

title: India Inc welcomes India-U.K. trade deal
content: Industry leaders have welcomed the deal signed by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and his British counterpart Jonanthan Reynolds

title: Driving with a fake insurance policy? Here’s how to check genuineness before it’s too late | Explained
content: Why are so many individuals falling prey to vehicle insurance fraud? How can one identify a fake insurance policy and what happens if one holds a fake policy?

title: Senior woman CPO suspended for alleged embezzlement of traffic fine of over ₹16 lakh
content: Internal audit team finds discrepancies and on closer examination noticed the use of whitener and different ink in the allegedly tampered documents.

title: HC collegiums yet to recommend names for 193 vacancies of judges: Government in Rajya Sabha
content: As many as 371 posts of judges are vacant in various high courts and against these vacancies, 178 proposals for appointment are at various stages of processing between the government and the Supreme Court Collegium, Mr. Meghwal said

title: Dhanbad mine 'collapse': NDRF rescue operation yet to begin as exact location remains unidentified
content: Local residents claimed that a closed underground mine in BCCL's Block-2 caved in, trapping around half-a-dozen hired workers linked to an illegal mining syndicate.

title: Ghulam Nabi Azad confident of Centre restoring statehood to J&K
content: Ghulam Nabi Azad asserted that statehood is an absolute necessity for the development and progress of the region.

title: The NFL's All-Under-Pressure Team: 15 people with something huge on the line in 2025
content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

title: Packers: Received $432.6M in revenue sharing
content: The Packers, the NFL's only publicly owned team, revealed that the national revenue sharing from the previous fiscal year was a record $432.6 million.

title: USC freshman Arenas injures knee, out 6-8 months
content: USC freshman Alijah Arenas, who was the No. 13 recruit in the ESPN 100, will need surgery after injuring his knee and will sit out six to eight months, the school announced.

title: Rays option Bradley to minors after rough start
content: The Rays optioned Taj Bradley to Triple-A Durham following a poor start for the inconsistent right-hander Wednesday night.

title: Aggies' collie mascot has surgery to remove eye
content: Reveille X, Texas A&M's beloved collie mascot, was resting comfortably after having her right eye surgically removed after being diagnosed with glaucoma.

title: Ohtani ties Dodgers' mark with HR in 5th straight
content: Shohei Ohtani homered for the fifth consecutive game, becoming the seventh player in Dodgers franchise history to accomplish that feat.

title: Griner honored in Phoenix return as Dream win
content: In her first game back in Phoenix, where she played 11 seasons and won a title, Brittney Griner had 17 points to lead the Dream to a 90-79 win on Wednesday night.

title: Clean slate: Rockies get 1st shutout in 221 games
content: Rookie right-hander Tanner Gordon led the way as the Rockies recorded their first shutout in 221 games, ending the third-longest streak without one in MLB history.

title: MLB trade dominoes: Predicting where the 10 biggest names on the market will land
content: Based on what ESPN's Jeff Passan is hearing, we predict where the top trade candidates will land -- and how they affect each other.

title: McGee's Mascot Power Rankings: The best of the fun and furry in college football
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal? Best pick?
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo polled executives and scouts on this NBA season's upcoming rookie class. Who will win ROY? Which players will surpass expectations?

title: Rebuild rankings: How close 14 teams are to title contention
content: Is Dallas' rebuild already complete? How close is San Antonio? We examine the paths forward for 14 teams that missed the playoffs.

title: 'It's 100% addictive': Cowboys coach Schottenheimer reveals the meaning of his tattoos
content: From his "whys" to his "life license plate," Schottenheimer explains his ink and what he'll do if he wins a Super Bowl.

title: We ranked the 50 most impactful NFL offseason moves
content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1?

title: MLB Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

title: Pete Rose history on display at Baseball Hall of Fame
content: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum's archives contain dozens of items related to MLB's hits king.

title: In the wake of tragedy, can Liverpool win a second straight Premier League title?
content: Diogo Jota's death casts an immense shadow over Liverpool's preseason preparations, but new arrivals have strengthened the squad. Could the Reds win the Premier League title again?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to enter race for Sesko
content: Manchester United are set to enter the race to sign RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What to expect from Ohtani as a pitcher for the rest of 2025
content: Shohei Ohtani has ramped up his workload since making his pitching debut as a Dodger back on June 16,

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Odunze, McCarthy among favorite breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Deion Sanders on hand at Shilo's first Bucs training camp practice
content: The Colorado Buffaloes head coach also held conversations with the Buccaneers head coach and head of player engagement at the practice.

title: Betting buzz: Dallas Cowboys' season win total lowest since 2003
content: The Cowboys' win total for this season has dropped to 7.5 at ESPN BET, the lowest preseason win total for a Cowboys team since 2003.

title: Semifinal talking points: Bonmatí's genius, England's luck, too few teams?
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship is on to the final. But what stood out for our reporters?

title: Bonmatí's star power shines through as Spain see off Germany -- just barely
content: Aitana Bonmatí struck an extra-time winner to send Spain into Sunday's Euro 2025 final against England.

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: While the top three squads from last week's power rankings remain steady, the Whipsnakes have moved up to the No. 4 spot.

title: Pound for pound: Shakur, 'Bam' Rodriguez move up after exciting wins
content: Oleksandr Usyk is still No. 1, but where do Shakur Stevenson and Jesse Rodriguez land? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Divisional: Pacquiao reenters welterweight top 10
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'Act against those who misuse freedom': PM Modi to Starmer on Khalistan threat in UK
content: Prime Minister Modi urged his UK counterpart to act against extremist ideologies exploiting democratic freedoms, amidst rising pro-Khalistani influence in Britain. Modi emphasized the need to hold accountable those who undermine democracy, following the signing of a free trade agreement. He also addressed the extradition of economic offenders, assuring coordinated efforts.

title: India-UK trade deal: How will the FTA benefit India? Top 10 takeaways
content: The India-UK free trade agreement, signed recently, promises significant gains for India, including duty-free access to UK markets for 99% of exports. This landmark deal is set to boost job opportunities in labor-intensive sectors, reduce tariffs on British goods like cars and whiskey, and increase agricultural exports.

title: Fighter jets: Flying towards scary parity with Pakistan
content: With the last MiG-21s getting phased out, IAF will have almost the same number of fighter squadrons as Pakistan’s air force. And it can get worse. Here’s why

title: Donald Trump vows to keep these AI models out of America, says no place for ...
content: President Trump signed executive orders targeting "woke AI" in federal government use, aiming to prevent DEI influence on AI models. The administration argues that incorporating DEI principles can lead to biased outcomes and ideological manipulation. The orders seek to ensure AI tools remain neutral and nonpartisan, prioritizing truthfulness and accuracy.

title: Thailand-Cambodia clash: How Hindu temple is at centre of deadly border dispute
content: Tensions between Thailand and Cambodia have escalated into deadly violence along their contested border, marked by exchanges of fire, airstrikes, and diplomatic expulsions. The conflict, rooted in a century-old dispute over the Preah Vihear temple and surrounding land, has seen both nations accusing each other of aggression.

title: 'Unacceptable': India on CPEC expansion, slams China-Pak-Afghanistan meet
content: India has firmly reiterated its opposition to the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), deeming its expansion or third-party involvement, including Afghanistan's, as unacceptable. Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh informed the Rajya Sabha that India has consistently protested CPEC's inclusion in the Belt and Road Initiative, as it traverses Indian territories under Pakistan's illegal occupation.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I’ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: Cars, whisky & leather: All about multi-billion dollar India-UK FTA
content: India-UK free trade deal: In a landmark move, India and the UK have formalized a free trade agreement aimed at boosting bilateral trade to $120 billion by 2030. The agreement, signed by key ministers and witnessed by both Prime Ministers, will reduce tariffs on various goods, benefiting both nations' economies.

title: Air India tragedy: 112 pilots called in sick in a day after crash
content: Following the devastating Air India AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, which claimed 260 lives, 112 pilots reported sick on June 16, Parliament was informed. The government stated there was a minor increase in sick leave across all fleets. DGCA has reinforced mental health support for flight crew.

title: 'Era of development, not expansionism': PM Modi's stern message to China
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke against expansionism. He indirectly referred to China's actions in the Indo-Pacific. This statement occurred during a press briefing with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer. Both leaders discussed peace and stability. They also addressed the Ukraine conflict and West Asia situation. Respect for sovereignty is essential. China's assertiveness is a global concern.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock sends 'China diktat' to employees
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: IND vs ENG: Jagadeesan set to be added as a cover for injured Pant; waiting for visa
content: N Jagadeesan is likely to join the Indian team in England as cover for the injured Rishabh Pant, who suffered a metatarsal fracture. With Ishan Kishan also injured, selectors turned to Jagadeesan, currently awaiting visa processing. Pant had injured his toe on the opening day of the fourth Test while attempting a reverse sweep.

title: Thailand-Cambodia face-off: Borders shut, F-16 deployed, civilians killed
content: Recent clashes between Thailand and Cambodia over disputed border territories near ancient temples have escalated, resulting in casualties and diplomatic breakdowns. Thailand expelled the Cambodian ambassador following a landmine incident, while Cambodia retaliated by downgrading ties. Military exchanges intensified, with both sides accusing each other of aggression, including airstrikes and artillery fire.

title: Asia Cup: India, Pakistan likely to be in same group; BCCI to announce schedule
content: The Asia Cup 2025, slated to be held in the UAE, is set to feature a highly anticipated India versus Pakistan clash. BCCI's Rajiv Shukla and ACC president and PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi will finalise venues and schedules soon. Despite heightened tensions, the BCCI is seeking government permission for the match, with the tournament acting as preparation for the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Did HC apply mind?' SC slams K'taka court over bail to Darshan in murder case
content: The Supreme Court expressed strong displeasure with the Karnataka High Court's handling of actor Darshan's bail in the Renukaswamy murder case. Justice Pardiwala questioned the High Court's approach. He suggested the bail order resembled an acquittal. The Karnataka government sought cancellation of Darshan's bail. Renukaswamy was allegedly abducted and murdered in Bengaluru.

title: Indian caught shoplifting: Singapore arrests man, goods worth Rs 3 lakh stolen
content: An Indian man was apprehended at Singapore's Changi Airport for allegedly stealing perfumes, cosmetics, and bags worth over S$5,136 from 14 stores. Police identified him from CCTV footage after a bag went missing from a Jewel Changi retail outlet. He was arrested upon his return to Singapore while transiting through the airport, and the stolen items were recovered.

title: IND vs ENG : Can Ishan step in as cover for injured Pant? No he can't
content: Ishan Kishan, initially considered as Rishabh Pant's replacement for the fifth Test match, is unfit due to an ankle injury sustained in a driving accident, resulting in ten stitches and a plaster cast. While the BCCI hasn't officially confirmed, TimesofIndia.com can confirm Pant has a fractured toe which will require extensive rehabilitation.

title: NEET PG 2025: What forced hundreds of TN aspirants to travel across states?
content: NEET PG 2025 aspirants from Tamil Nadu are in a fix. Many got exam centres in Andhra Pradesh, far from their home state. This unexpected allotment causes logistical and financial problems. The Tamil Nadu Resident Doctors Association has appealed to the Union Health Ministry. They seek reallocation of centres within Tamil Nadu. Students and associations urge immediate intervention.

title: IND vs ENG Test: BCCI issue statement on Pant's injury - latest update
content: Rishabh Pant's right foot injury during the fourth Test at Old Trafford has sidelined him from wicket-keeping duties, with Dhruv Jurel stepping in. Despite the setback, Pant may bat if needed. His absence compounds India's challenges, adding to a growing injury list including key players.

title: Man parades 8-month-old son upside down in UP village over dowry
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district, a shocking video surfaced showing a man parading his 8-month-old child upside down, sparking public outrage. Police intervened after the video went viral on July 19, 2025, booking the father for disturbing public peace. The incident stemmed from a marital dispute, with the wife alleging dowry demands of Rs 2 lakh and a car.

title: Bengaluru stampede victim's mother claims gold earrings vanished after autopsy
content: A family alleges theft of gold jewelry from their daughter's body during the post-mortem following the Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede in Bengaluru, which claimed 11 lives after an RCB victory parade. The father filed a complaint at the Commercial Street police station. The stampede occurred due to poor crowd control, with an estimated 3 lakh people gathering.

title: Planning a US trip? Trump's new policy may add extra Rs 20k to your visa cost - check details
content: The Trump administration's new policy introduces a $250 "visa integrity fee" for non-immigrant visa applicants, impacting tourists, students, and business travelers from countries like India and China. This fee, in addition to the existing $185 application cost, raises concerns within the tourism industry, with leaders fearing it will deter international visitors.

title: Climate change alert: 100 dams in 6 Himalayan states at risk
content: In response to escalating risks from glacial lake outburst floods (GLOFs), the Central Water Commission has issued new guidelines for over 100 dams across six Himalayan states. These directives, prompted by climate change-induced glacier melt and increasing glacial lakes, mandate enhanced spillway capacity for new dams and retrofitting measures for existing ones.

title: IND vs ENG | Woakes breaks silence on hitting Pant's toe: 'I didn’t think...'
content: Chris Woakes discussed the delivery that injured Rishabh Pant's toe, leading to a fracture and his withdrawal from the ongoing Test series. Woakes suspected Pant might attack, so he bowled a slower, fuller ball that struck Pant's foot unexpectedly. Scans revealed a fracture, and Ishan Kishan is likely to replace him as wicketkeeper.

title: Training, safety issues: DGCA slaps Air India with 4 show-cause notices
content: The DGCA has issued a stern warning to Air India, threatening action over safety violations, including crew fatigue management and training protocols. The regulator cited 29 violations, such as insufficient pilot rest, poor simulator training compliance, and inadequate crew on international routes. This follows Air India's self-reporting of issues after a plane crash in Ahmedabad.

title: Burning fuselage found: Russian plane with 49 on board crashes; no survivors
content: A plane carrying 50 individuals disappeared in Russia's far east on Thursday after losing contact with air traffic control. Operated by Angara airline, the aircraft was nearing Tynda in the Amur region, bordering China. Communication ceased just kilometers from its destination, prompting immediate concern and initiating search efforts to locate the missing aircraft and its passengers.

title: Locals thrash 'drunk' Indore cop for 'visiting' married woman’s house
content: In Indore's Khajrana area, a sub-inspector named Suresh Bunkar faced a brutal assault by women and locals after being found inside a woman's house early Thursday. Accused of being drunk and misbehaving, he was beaten, and attempts were made to strip him.

title: Donald Trump’s indicates he won’t go below 15% tariff rate; says 'we’ll have a straight…'
content: US President Donald Trump has signaled a potential shift in trade strategy, suggesting a baseline tariff of 15% for most nations, potentially reaching 50% for countries with strained relations. This move marks a departure from pursuing individual trade agreements, with Trump indicating tariff letters as completed deals.

title: This Filipino couple got married in a submerged church; here's why
content: In a remarkable display of resilience, a Filipino couple exchanged vows in a flooded church near Manila, highlighting the country's struggle with chronic flooding. The wedding proceeded despite knee-deep water caused by monsoon rains and Typhoon Wipha, symbolizing the couple's commitment amidst adversity.

title: Rishabh Pant fractures toe: From free-wheeling shots to moon boot - how events unfolded
content: In a significant setback for India, Rishabh Pant is likely out for the England Test series due to a toe fracture. Scans revealed a compound fracture after Pant was hit on the boot during the fourth Test, potentially sidelining him for six to eight weeks. He retired hurt and was taken to a medical facility.

title: ‘It’s Loktantra, not Loktantar’: BJP mocks spelling error in oppn banner
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has criticized the opposition for a spelling error on a banner during a protest concerning electoral roll revisions in Bihar. The opposition alleges that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls is being misused to suppress votes.

title: Gokarna cave saga: HC halts deportation of Russian woman’s kids
content: The Karnataka High Court has temporarily halted the deportation of two Russian children, acting on a petition citing their welfare and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child. This decision came after the children and their mother were found in Gokarna, with the court emphasizing the need for a detailed hearing and document verification before any deportation action.

title: 'You're educated, earn yourself': Woman seeks BMW, luxury flat after 18-month marriage; SC denies
content: The Supreme Court of India has emphasized that financially capable women should strive for self-reliance rather than seeking substantial alimony, especially in short marriages. This stance was highlighted during a case involving an IT professional seeking significant assets after only 18 months of marriage.

title: 'We are going to come for you': Rahul Gandhi's message to EC on Bihar SIR
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of enabling electoral fraud in Karnataka, claiming to possess “100% proof” of voter manipulation. He alleged voter deletions, unauthorized additions, and suspicious new voters. Gandhi also targeted the Standardisation of Electoral Rolls drive in Bihar, warning the Election Commission of consequences.

title: TMC worker hacked to death in West Bengal
content: In West Bengal's Murshidabad district, a Trinamool Congress activist, Sasthi Ghosh, was allegedly murdered by unidentified assailants. Ghosh was attacked with a sharp tool while returning home, leading to his death at a nearby hospital. While a property dispute is suspected, Ghosh’s family claims the attack was politically motivated, prompting a police investigation and manhunt for the accused.

title: ‘Real war’: North Korea calls for preparedness for military action ‘anytime’
content: Kim Jong Un has called on North Korean soldiers to be ready for war. He oversaw an artillery drill. North Korea continues to support Russia in the Ukraine war. Reports suggest North Korean soldiers are deployed in Russia. Some have been killed fighting for Russia. Russia warned the US, South Korea, and Japan against forming alliances against North Korea.

title: 'Well-planned scheme to siphon off public money': ED raids Anil Ambani
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is conducting a large-scale investigation into the Reliance Anil Ambani Group (RAAGA) companies, involving 35 premises and 50 companies. The probe centers on the alleged laundering of approximately Rs 3,000 crore received as loans from Yes Bank between 2017 and 2019. ED found gross violations in loan approvals, including backdated documents and lack of due diligence.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Pant's absence is a 25% swing to England' – Vaughan on India's setback
content: Vice-captain Rishabh Pant's injury on Day 1 of the fourth Test is a major setback for India, potentially jeopardizing their chances of leveling the series against England. Pant's absence, after being hurt attempting a reverse sweep, removes a key batter and wicketkeeper, significantly impacting India's batting depth and overall strategy.

title: US sanctions warnings unheeded: Indian firm exports explosive compound to Russia
content: Despite warnings of potential US sanctions, an Indian firm exported $1.4 million worth of HMX, a military-grade explosive, to Russia in December. India maintains its historical military and economic partnerships with Moscow whilst strengthening its alliance with the United States.

title: Saiyaara box office: Film takes a slow start on Thursday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama Saiyaara has become a blockbuster, earning an impressive Rs 155.24 crore net in India within its first week. Powered by fresh talent and soulful music, the film exceeded expectations, achieving remarkable daily collections and holding strong even on weekdays. Saiyaara's success is particularly noteworthy as it was achieved without established superstars.

title: Chess : Divya one step away from historic WC title; but all she wants is 'sleep'
content: India’s 19-year-old chess prodigy Divya Deshmukh created history by becoming the first Indian to reach the FIDE Women’s World Cup final. In a five-hour battle, she defeated third seed Tan Zhongyi, securing her first GM norm, a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament, and $35,000. “I just need sleep,” she said.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Man gropes, kisses college student at market; arrested
content: In east Bengaluru, an 18-year-old college student was harassed while shopping for necessities. A stranger approached, forcibly kissed her, and touched her inappropriately before she managed to escape. Traumatized, the girl reported the incident to the police, who are now investigating using CCTV footage and have registered a case against the perpetrator.

title: 5 dead, around 20 injured as bus falls into gorge near Mandi
content: A devastating bus accident took place near Maseran, Sarkaghat. The incident, occurring about 60 km from Mandi, led to the loss of seven lives. Around 20 individuals suffered injuries, with several in critical condition at Sarkaghat hospital. SP Mandi Sakshi Verma is leading the police and local administration in rescue efforts. The authorities are providing relief to the affected.

title: Woman dances on bonnet of moving car in Navi Mumbai for reel; booked
content: Navi Mumbai police detained a woman, Nazmeen Sulde, and her friend, Al-fesh Shaikh, after a video went viral showing Sulde dancing on the bonnet of a moving car while Shaikh drove. The incident, filmed by a passing motorist, led police to trace the car through CCTV footage. They have been booked under Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita and Motor Vehicle Act.

title: "No Innocent Should Be Punished": Ajit Pawar's Big Statement On Train Blast
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, speaking today on the Supreme Court verdict in the 2006 Mumbai train blasts case, said "some innocent people were also trapped in this case".

title: "From Having Everything To Nothing": How 2 Families Crossed War-Torn Gaza
content: The Bakrons and al-Bareems, two families from opposite ends of Gaza, have criss-crossed the rubble-strewn territory many times during 21 months of war, in search of food and shelter from Israeli attacks.

title: Australian Women Strip-Searched On Qatar Airways Win Right To Sue Airline
content: Five Australian women who say they were pulled from a Qatar Airways flight by armed guards and stripsearched have won the right to sue the airline, after a court

title: Government Staff Can Take 30-Day Leave To Care For Elderly Parents: Centre
content: The service rules allow 30 days' leave to Central government employees, which can be availed for any personal reason including that of taking care of elderly parents, Union Minister of State for Personnel Jitendra Singh said in Rajya Sabha on Thursda

title: Opinion: Blog | Sky-High Rent, Choked Roads: How Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi Became India's Chaos Capitals
content: Your office may be cool and your home furnishings plush, but there is little you can do about the confusion outside.

title: Rockets Fired In Thailand-Cambodia Border Dispute: What We Know So Far
content: Thailand launched air strikes on Cambodian military targets on Thursday as Cambodia fired rockets and artillery, killing at least 11 civilians, in a sharp escalation of a long-running border dispute.

title: How This Engineer's Campaign Led To Bengaluru's First Feeder Bus
content: There is a story behind Metro Feeder Bus 314A/1, launched on July 19 by Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) to serve the residents of Kaggadasapura and C V Raman Nagar.

title: Man Gets Death Sentence For Killing Mother To Seize Her Rs 32 Lakh FD
content: A trial court in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur has sentenced a 26-year-old man to death for murdering a woman who had adopted him as her son and concealing the body in a wall to usurp her fixed deposit of Rs 32 lakh.

title: Trump Admin Cancels $4.9 Billion Loan Guarantee For Green Power Project
content: The Trump administration on Wednesday cancelled a $4.9 billion federal loan guarantee for a new high-voltage transmission line for delivering solar and wind-generated electricity from the Midwest to the eastern US.

title: 'Unshakable Proof': Intelligence Chief Gabbard On Trump-Russia Probe
content: As the national intelligence director, Tulsi Gabbard is responsible for guarding America's secrets and discovering threats from overseas. But when she made a surprise appearance in the White House briefing room Wednesday

title: Historic Day For India-UK Relations: PM Modi On Free Trade Pact
content: India and UK on Thursday inked a landmark free trade pact that will increase market access, cut tariffs on British whisky and cars among other items and double bilateral trade by 2030 as the two strategic partners vowed to chart a new growth path.

title: From Cars And Chocolates To Scotch And Salmon: What Gets Cheaper With India-UK Trade Deal
content: On Thursday, the India-UK Free Trade Agreement was signed and formalised, during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the UK, where he met his counterpart Keir Starmer.

title: Friend Treats Boy To Chhole Bhature, Kills Him For Following Girlfriend On Social Media In UP
content: He followed his friend's girlfriend on social media, but it enraged his friend, who hatched a plan to kill him. The boy was stabbed to death in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad by his friends for sending a follow request.

title: Doctor, 57, Meets Man On Gay Date, Loses 8 Lakh To Nude Pics Blackmail
content: A 57-year-old doctor's date at a Varanasi hotel ended in extortion as the man he connected with clicked his nude photos and threatened to circulate them unless he paid up

title: 7-Year-Old Girl Mauled To Death By Leopard In UP's Bijnor: Cops
content: A 7-year-old girl was mauled to death by a leopard in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor district, police said on Thursday. Tanika was playing outside her home in Mandoura village late Wednesday when a leopard dragged her away into a field nearby.

title: How Much Cheaper Will Whiskey Be After India-UK Free Trade Deal: 10 Points
content: The India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) will lead to a reduction in prices of scotch whiskey, but not to such an extent that it would reshape the market. The price cuts are highly dependent on the pricing mechanism of every state.

title: 183 Technical Defects Reported By Airlines In Aircraft Till July 21 In 2025
content: Five Indian airlines reported 183 technical defects in their aircraft to the aviation regulator DGCA this year till July 21, including 85 by Air India Group, according to the government.

title: Goa's Feni, Kerala's Toddy To Get Shelf Space In UK Stores After Trade Deal
content: India's unique traditional craft beverages, including Goa's feni, Nashik's artisanal wines, and Kerala's toddy, are set to gain recognition in the UK as the two countries signed the free trade agreement on Thursday.

title: "Have 100% Proof": Rahul Gandhi Claims Poll Panel Allowed Cheating In Karnataka
content: The Congress has "concrete 100 per cent proof" that the Election Commission allowed cheating in a constituency in Karnataka, Rahul Gandhi claimed on Thursday.

title: With 2026 In Sight, PM Modi To Visit Tamil Nadu For Chola Emperor Celebration
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Tamil Nadu on July 26 and 27 in what is seen as a politically and culturally significant trip ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections.

title: Bring down age of consent from 18 to 16 years, Supreme Court told
content: Ms. Jaising said the legal framework wrongly equates consensual relationships between adolescents with abuse, ignoring their autonomy, maturity, and capacity to consent

title: NIT-Tiruchi achieves 87% placements in 2025
content: Over 286 organisations took part in placements and offered 1,322 jobs to the students, says NIT-Tiruchi Director G. Aghila; convocation to be held on July 26

title: IMD predicts heavy rainfall in Jharkhand over next 2 days
content: For Friday, it issued an 'orange' alert (be prepared), predicting very heavy rainfall in three districts, and 'yellow' alert (be aware), forecasting heavy rainfall in 17 districts

title: ‘Minor’ increase in sick reporting by pilots at Air India following the June 12 crash, says government
content: Some sources among pilots claim that the daily average of sick reporting at Air India is in the range of 40-50. There are nearly 3,500 pilots employed with Air India

title: Filling up of vacancies in govt. departments continuous process: Centre in Rajya Sabha
content: The government has issued instructions to all Ministries/departments for taking timely and advance action to fill up vacant/unfilled posts through direct recruitment, says Union Minister Jitendra Singh in the Rajya Sabha

title: Five dead, several injured as HRTC bus falls into gorge in Himachal Pradesh’s Sarkaghat
content: Mandi Superintendent of Police Sakshi Verma stated that around 20 people sustained injuries in the accident and are currently receiving treatment at the Sarkaghat hospital.

title: University of Hyderabad incubated startup announces successful animal trials of stem cell therapy for liver failure
content: Chronic liver failure remains a serious public health concern in India, contributing to nearly 20% of global liver-related deaths; with transplantation being the only current treatment, investigational product - ‘Tulsi-28X’ represents a potential paradigm shift.

title: GST notices in Karnataka was bid to recover revenue lost to guarantee schemes, says Mysuru MP Yaduveer Wadiyar
content: The controversial tax notices, which targeted micro enterprises, including bakeries and condiment vendors, demanded lakhs of rupees in dues — some dating back four to five years — sparking widespread panic among small traders

title: Panchayat Progress Index 2.0: GPs in Mandya told to achieve sustainable development goals
content: The ZP CEO instructed all Panchayat Development Officers to seek the cooperation and support of all elected representatives in their jurisdiction, other departments, and the people towards achieving the goals.

title: T.N. CM Stalin undergoes diagnostic angiogram; results normal: Apollo Hospitals
content: The Chief Minister underwent various investigations at the hospital for symptoms related to giddiness

title: Govt appoints former Finance Secretary Ajay Seth as IRDAI chief
content: The appointment of IRDAI chairman comes nearly four months after the vacancy was created following Debasish Panda completing his term in March this year

title: Nitish no longer enjoys Amit Shah's trust, claims RJD's Tejashwi
content: If indeed Shah still has faith in the leadership of Kumar, let him put to rest all speculations and declare that the chief minister will continue to occupy the seat of power till 2030, says RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav

title: India and U.K. sign the Free Trade Agreement,  PM Modi and Keir Starmer hold bilateral talk
content: The FTA is expected to benefit Indian exports from tariff and will make it easier for British firms to export whisky, car and other products to India

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka government to take legal action against RCB, KSCA, DNA, and order departmental inquiry against five suspended police officers
content: Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil said whoever is responsible for the stampede and negligence have been indicated in Justice D’Cunha report.

title: 24-year study reveals that coral cover in Lakshadweep saw 50% reduction
content: Study warns that no amount of local resilience and restoration efforts, especially in regions that do not support corals that make up a resilient cluster, can substitute urgent global climate action

title: Dharmasthala burial probe: Home Minister adds to confusion by saying some officers want to be excused from SIT, but no official communication yet
content: Dr .Parameshwara said that he is aware about DCP (CAR) Soumyalatha S.K.’s desire to be excused from being a part of the SIT for personal reasons, but there is no official communication yet

title: Trinamool Congress activist hacked to death in Bengal’s Murshidabad
content: The reason behind the killing could be personal enmity over property matters but the exact motive will be known following an investigation, a police officer said

title: Harshvardhan Jain: the fake ‘Diplomat’ who ran ‘embassy’ in Ghaziabad and his controversial past
content: The London educated Harshvardhan Jain was arrested in 2012 for unlawfulling possessing a satellite phone.

title: ED raids 'fake' call centres duping foreigners on pretext of offering tech solutions in Chandigarh
content: The searches were launched on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday in Chandigarh and adjoining cities of Mohali in Punjab and Panchkula in Haryana under the provisions of the PMLA

title: Connectivity problems between rest of Karnataka and the ‘West of Karnataka’ for decades reflects poorly on State: NMPA Chairman
content: Every year, the connectivity issue is being discussed without there being any solution, says A. V. Ramana

title: 100% proof of ECI allowing cheating, will not allow poll body to get away with it: Rahul Gandhi
content: I want to send a message to the Election Commission — if you thing you are going to get away with this, if your officers think they are going to get away with this, you are mistaken... says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Supreme Court to hear West Bengal challenge to HC stay on fresh OBC list exercise on July 28
content: The Bench listed the case for hearing on July 28. “The contempt should not go on,” Mr. Sibal urged. The Chief Justice indicated that the court would pass orders on Monday

title: School Cafe project gains ground in schools in Kerala’s Kannur with low-cost meals and study support
content: Following the success of the first Scoofe at Kannadiparmba Government Higher Secondary School, the initiative is being expanded to all schools in Kannur

title: Can't allow dead, those who have permanently migrated to be on voters' list: CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar said allowing ineligible people to vote, first in Bihar and later in the entire country, is against the Constitution

title: PMK founder Ramadoss seeks ban on Anbumani’s upcoming padayatra
content: Mr. Ramadoss said the police should stop Mr. Anbumani from taking out the padayatra as it would give rise to law and order issues in north Tamil Nadu

title: Bengaluru to host international space leadership meet Karman Week 2025 in October
content: This year’s selected delegation includes representatives from Axiom Space, Airbus, the Saudi Space Agency, the UK Space Agency, and the Kenya Space Agency

title: Food delivery executive arrested for filming women on Bengaluru roads
content: The social media monitoring cell of the Bengaluru police took cognizance and a suo motu case was registered

title: Woman police officer in Kerala booked, suspended for embezzling over ₹16 lakh from fine amounts
content: The accused, a senior civil police officer, has been booked for the offences of forgery, using a forged document as genuine, criminal breach of trust by a public servant and cheating under the IPC, according to FIR

title: Supreme Court asks HC to hear Bhopal gas victims’ claim of ‘misclassification’ of illnesses on merits
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justice Vinod Chandran asked the High Court to decide the case on its own merits. The apex court clarified that it had not ventured into the merits of the plea.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Opposition protests stall proceedings for fourth day
content: Opposition members protested demanding a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar

title: PM Modi London visit LIVE: India and U.K. sign Free Trade Agreement
content: India’s landmark free trade pact with the U.K. will benefit it significantly as the deal will ensure the elimination of tariffs on approximately 99% of tariff lines, covering nearly 100% of the trade value

title: Ex-Punjab police officer sentenced to 10-year rigorous imprisonment in 1993 fake encounter case
content: The CBI, which carried out the investigation on the directions of the Supreme Court in 1995, found that the two unidentified militants who were killed in the encounter were actually two police constables

title: Telangana factory blast: Disbursed ₹10 lakh each to families of 15 dead, says Sigachi
content: Sigachi had announced earlier that an ex gratia compensation of ₹1 crore to the families of the deceased. The remaining will be disbursed in a phased and structured manner.

title: Enforcement Directorate searches multiple locations in a case allegedly involving Anil Ambani group companies
content: More than 35 premises in Mumbai and Delhi of 50 companies and about 25 persons are being searched under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), they said

title: Kerala rains: Cyclone Wipha likely to bring heavy rain across State; orange alert for two districts, yellow for seven
content: Rainfall, winds expected to further strengthen from Friday as remnants of tropical cyclone Wipha over north Bay of Bengal have taken the shape of a low-pressure system

title: Andhra Pradesh will become a strategic node in ‘India-UAE economic corridor’, says UAE Minister Abdulla Al Marri
content: Stating that he is astonished with its infrastructure, availability of natural resources, especially rivers and long coastline, rich human capital, and good connectivity, he says he will facilitate dialogues that bring in synergies and investments, including venture capital, to the State

title: India calls for ceasefire in Gaza, says intermittent pauses ‘not enough’
content: Underlining that the way ahead is clear, and highlighting India’s consistent position in this regard, India’s Permanent Representative to the U.N. Ambassador said the ongoing human suffering must not be allowed to continue

title: Achieve sustainable development but not by bulldozing forests: Supreme Court tells Telangana
content: “I am myself an advocate for sustainable development, but that doesn’t mean that overnight you should employ 30 bulldozers and clear all the jungle,” Chief Justice Gavai said

title: Railways to launch portal for Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members to book reserved tickets online
content: The development of software for booking reserved tickets online by sitting as well as former Parliamentarians has been taken up. This will facilitate them to book/cancel the ticket online as per their convenience

title: What India needs from U.K. is another FTA — Fugitive Transfer Agreement: Congress’ dig at government
content: Congress said that what India needs from U.K. is the announcement of another and more effective FTA — Fugitive Transfer Agreement

title: Dam on upper reaches Brahmaputra will not impact India, Bangladesh: China
content: Playing down the concerns of the lower riparian states, the Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said that they have cooperated with India and Bangladesh by sharing hydrological data, flood prevention, disaster alleviation

title: Devendra Fadnavis to inaugurate Kusumagaraj Marathi language centre at JNU
content: Maharashtra government wants to construct an equestrian statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in JNU campus

title: Thousands in Kerala offer ‘bali tharpanam’ on Karkidaka Vavu to honour ancestors and departed souls
content: Hundreds, including senior citizens, women and children, throng beachfronts, riversides, and bathing ghats under an overcast sky, revering their ancestors and the recently dead

title: Opposition may boycott Bihar poll, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: The RJD leader alleged the Election Commission is for “working at the behest of BJP and ruling NDA” and might boycott the polls after taking feedback from people and alliance partners

title: India sends burn injury specialists to Bangladesh to assist air crash survivors
content: Two burn injury specialists and a nursing assistant from India’s topmost burn injury hospitals – Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and Safdarjung Hospital – reached Dhaka to help the injured

title: India's mobile phone exports rise 127 times to ₹2 lakh crore in 10 years
content: Minister of State for Electronics and IT Jitin Prasada said that 75% of the total mobile phone demand in India was met through imports in 2014-15, which has now dropped to 0.02% in 2024-25

title: Damned if they do, or don’t: AIADMK’s impossible choice on alliance with BJP
content: The regional party’s tie up with the BJP offers possible short-term gains but comes with the risk of losing identity and voter base

title: India, China review border situation, prepare for Special Representatives dialogue
content: The MEA said India and China prepared for the next round of the Special Representatives' talks on the boundary issue to be held in India later this year

title: EA College Football 26 review roundup: Improvement on all fronts
content: this year's iteration of the series stands at 83 on Metacritic based on 13 reviews on PS5 . the Xbox Series X|S version is noticeably less well regarded with 79 Metascore . opencritic lists CFB 26 with an average top critic score of 84 across platforms .

title: Numbers you need to know as you prep for draft day
content: numbers can tell us compelling stories, but they can mislead, usually when framed in a way to construct a narrative or support a specific claim . the numbers determine our teams' fates, and they have a massive say in our draft day, waiver wire and weekly lineup processes . as you prepare for the 2025 fantasy football season, .

title: Tom Aspinall booked his first title defense, but is it the right matchup?
content: new heavyweight champion Tom Aspinall looks to move on from the 12-month saga that was Jon Jones' retirement in an undisputed title defense against Ciryl Gane in the main event of UFC 321 on Oct. 25 in Abu Dhabi . aspinall will attempt to reclaim the light heavyweight championship in an immediate rematch .

title: One month until college football: Swing games for every Top 25 team
content: a month away from college football, we asked our reporters to single out one contest for each of our post-spring Top 25 teams that could swing their season one way or the other . some will come in major nonconference battles over the first couple of weeks, some are more traditional league games that could set the tone for the things to come .

title: Can Cardinals count on Jordan Walker?
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the first of the five games gets underway at 1:10 p.m. ET with the Cleveland Guardians going for the four-game sweep at home against the Baltimore Orioles .

title: Browns unveil new 'Alpha Dawg' helmets, will don in three regular-season games
content: the helmet, called "Alpha Dawg," will be worn three times in the upcoming 2025 season . the helmet features an all-brown matte shell with a brown stripe between two orange stripes in the middle . it's the first timothy robertson helmet to be worn in the 2025 .

title: The Gyökeres-to-Arsenal saga finally looks close to ending. What took so long?
content: arsenal are in a bad spot amid a transfer standoff with Sporting CP for Viktor Gyökeres . the striker's name is still looming over the club's preseason tour to Asia and he isn't even a Gunner yet . he'll shock everyone after an arsenal fan event at an Irish bar .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Summer storylines for all 32 teams
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

title: Passan's ultimate trade deadline preview: Best fits and latest intel
content: nearly three-quarters of major league baseball teams reside within 512 games of a playoff spot . this is a moment of discomfort for nearly every team in baseball . Getting talent in a trade can help win a World Series . Acquiring players can revitalize a farm system .

title: 👟 Clark surprises Iowa with Nike Kobe 5 Protros
content: WNBA star caitlin Clark surprised the Iowa Hawkeyes men's and women's basketball teams . she has consistently sported the Kobe Bryant signature shoe since her college days at Iowa . "it's not eve," she said last season .

title: MLS, minus Messi, beats Liga MX in All-Star Game

Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .
